name: BPC-157
description: A fragment of a protein found in gastric juice; known as "Body Protection Compound."
benefits: Promotes gut healing, tissue repair, reduced inflammation, may accelerate recovery from injuries.
protocol: Commonly used subcutaneously near the injury site or systemically; often 200–500 mcg daily, though protocols vary.

name: BPC-157 / TB-500
description: Combination of two regenerative peptides for synergistic repair support.
benefits: Synergistic effect for wound healing, tissue repair, angiogenesis (new blood vessel growth), and reduced inflammation.
protocol: Typically injected subcutaneously or intramuscularly; cycles often run 4–6 weeks with low daily or every-other-day dosing.

name: CJC-1295 / Ipamorelin
description: CJC-1295 (GHRH analog) combined with Ipamorelin (GHRP) to stimulate natural growth hormone release.
benefits: Improved sleep, recovery, lean muscle gain, fat loss, and anti-aging effects.
protocol: 100–300 mcg of each peptide administered subcutaneously, usually at night to align with endogenous GH pulses.

name: Epitalon
description: A synthetic tetrapeptide linked to anti-aging effects through telomerase activation.
benefits: May promote longevity, improve sleep quality, and support immune function.
protocol: Commonly used at 10–20 mg daily for 10–20 days, followed by a pause (cyclic use).

name: GHK-Cu
description: Copper-binding peptide naturally present in plasma and saliva.
benefits: Supports skin repair, hair growth, wound healing, and exhibits anti-inflammatory properties.
protocol: Typically administered subcutaneously; dosing ranges from 1–5 mg daily depending on application.

name: Humanin
description: Mitochondrial-derived peptide with cytoprotective effects.
benefits: Neuroprotective, anti-apoptotic, with potential anti-aging and metabolic benefits.
protocol: Research usage often explores microgram dosing, injected subcutaneously daily or 2–3 times weekly.

name: KPV
description: Short peptide derived from alpha-MSH.
benefits: Potent anti-inflammatory peptide studied for gut health, colitis, and inflammatory bowel disease.
protocol: Often dosed subcutaneously at 250–500 mcg daily.

name: Kisspeptin
description: Neuropeptide that regulates reproduction via GnRH stimulation.
benefits: Supports fertility, hormonal balance, and may boost libido.
protocol: Dosing varies; typically low microgram amounts administered subcutaneously on a daily or cyclic schedule.

name: MOTS-c
description: Mitochondrial-derived peptide that influences metabolic function.
benefits: Improves insulin sensitivity, supports fat metabolism, and may increase energy levels.
protocol: Typically 5–15 mg injected subcutaneously two to three times per week in research settings.

name: NAD+
description: Essential coenzyme critical for cellular energy production and DNA repair.
benefits: Supports mitochondrial health, healthy aging, energy production, and cognition.
protocol: Commonly delivered via IV infusion (250–750 mg over 1–2 hours); subcutaneous or intramuscular routes are also studied.

name: PT-141 / Oxytocin
description: Melanocortin receptor agonist formulation focused on sexual wellness.
benefits: Enhances libido and sexual function for both men and women.
protocol: Often 1–2 mg subcutaneously, administered 30–60 minutes before sexual activity.

name: Retatrutide
description: Multi-receptor agonist targeting GLP-1, GIP, and glucagon receptors for weight management.
benefits: Supports weight loss, glucose control, and appetite suppression.
protocol: Weekly subcutaneous injections in clinical trials with dose escalation.

name: SS-31
description: Also known as Elamipretide; a mitochondrial-targeting peptide.
benefits: Protects mitochondria, improves cellular energy production, and reduces oxidative stress.
protocol: Typically 1–5 mg daily administered subcutaneously in research contexts.

name: Sermorelin
description: Growth hormone–releasing hormone analog that promotes endogenous GH output.
benefits: Supports recovery, fat loss, improved sleep, and anti-aging benefits.
protocol: Commonly 100–300 mcg injected subcutaneously, usually at night.

name: TB-500
description: Synthetic fragment of thymosin beta-4.
benefits: Encourages tissue repair, injury recovery, angiogenesis, and reduced inflammation.
protocol: Often 2–5 mg twice weekly administered subcutaneously or intramuscularly for 4–6 weeks.

name: Tesamorelin
description: GHRH analog with FDA approval for HIV-associated lipodystrophy.
benefits: Reduces visceral fat, promotes GH release, and improves body composition.
protocol: Typically 1–2 mg daily via subcutaneous injection.

name: Thymosin Alpha-1
description: Immune-modulating peptide supporting host defenses.
benefits: Enhances immune response with antiviral and anticancer potential.
protocol: Generally 1.6–4.8 mg administered subcutaneously two to three times weekly.

name: Tirzepatide
description: Dual GIP and GLP-1 receptor agonist designed for weight management.
benefits: Promotes significant weight loss, glucose regulation, and metabolic health.
protocol: Weekly subcutaneous injection with dose escalation from 2.5 mg up to 15 mg; the 40 mg vial serves as a multi-dose format.

name: BPC-157 / TB-500
description: Synergistic blend of regenerative peptides formulated for intranasal delivery.
benefits: Supports tissue repair, reduces inflammation, and enhances the healing response.
protocol: Nasal spray format allows daily or every-other-day use; dosing varies by formulation.

name: DSIP
description: Delta sleep–inducing peptide engineered for restorative rest.
benefits: Promotes restorative sleep, reduces stress, and supports hormone regulation.
protocol: Typically administered intranasally or via injection at 0.1–0.3 mg/kg before sleep.

name: NAD+
description: Critical coenzyme for cellular energy and DNA repair delivered in nasal spray format.
benefits: Supports mitochondrial function, cognitive clarity, healthy aging, and improved energy levels.
protocol: Nasal spray delivery for systemic support; commonly used daily or in cycles.

name: Selank
description: Anxiolytic peptide that produces calming effects without sedation.
benefits: Reduces anxiety, enhances focus, and may support memory formation.
protocol: Typically 200–500 mcg intranasally, two to three times daily.

name: Semax
description: Nootropic peptide derived from ACTH fragment for cognitive support.
benefits: Enhances cognitive function, supports memory, and provides neuroprotection.
protocol: Commonly 200–600 mcg intranasally, one to two times daily.

name: PT-141 / Oxytocin
description: Combination of libido-enhancing PT-141 with bonding hormone oxytocin.
benefits: Offers synergistic effects for sexual function, intimacy, and emotional connection.
protocol: Typically administered as 1–2 sprays before intimacy; specific dosing varies by formulation.
